03 申请规划概述 Overview of Application Planning

这一部分展示了规划导师与你沟通交流以后为你制定的申请意向专业方向、申请国家、申请形象、学术主线、个人特色副线。申请形象指的是你的申请材料希望给招生官展现你是怎样一个人，在一些可量化可直接对比的成绩成就奖项等硬件之外，还能体现你怎样的个性、品质、故事、特点、兴趣和热情，往往这些软性的东西更能让招生官对你印象深刻。学术主线是申请意向专业方向的展开和细化，个人特色副线则是在学术主线之外你的第二主要特点，有可能是另一个有一定联系或一定反差的学术线，也有可能是非学术的例如户外冒险、艺术音乐、某种理念追求、某个方面的社会关怀等等。学术主线和个人特色副线共同塑造一个更为立体、更为多元、更有区分度的申请形象，使你从同专业方向的申请者中脱颖而出。
·申请方向 ·申请地区 生态学 运动管理／人体运动学 动物科学 环境研究／可持续发展 美国
喜欢动物 每周15小时运动，竞赛水平

emphasizes the connection between scientific curiosity, empathy for living beings, and physical discipline through sports. Her profile will evolve around the theme “Sportsmanship + Compassion for Life", highlighting both academic exploration in an imal and life sciences and impactful community engagement.
这一部分记录了你9-12年级完整的在校成绩情况。在校成绩是招生官对你学术能力判断的基础指标，好的在校成绩是申请顶尖大学的基本门槛。另外在校选课应体现与申请意向专业方向相一致或相关联的学术兴趣。
这一部分记录了你已经取得的各项标化考试成绩以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的的未来标化考试计划。标化考试成绩是在校成绩之外的又一重要学术实力评判标准，顾名思义，它的意义在于更为标准化，不同学校的在校成绩往往很难比较，标化考试成绩弥补了这一点，于是也是很被招生官看重的。另外一些所在高中并不知名的学生可以通过标化考试进一步证明自己的学术能力基本面。
这一部分记录了你已经完成的课外活动、正在进行的课外活动、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的下一步课外活动计划。课外活动是体现软实力的重要阵地，通过合理的规划，我们希望通过课外活动有重点、有层次、有细节、有亮点、生动全面地体现你的申请形象、学术主线、个人特色副线。将来在大学网申中你的活动细节无法在有限的活动列表描述字符中体现的部分我们也会考虑通过额外信息部分加以展开和展示。）
·Take advanced courses in Biology (cellular and molecular), Chemistry (including Organic Chemistry if available),and electives in Anatomy, Physiology, or Animal Behavior.
·Join animal behavior, nutrition, or physiology research projects, or participate in community college or university lab internships to gain hands-on exposure to scientific inquiry.
·Volunteer or intern at veterinary clinics, animal hospitals, shelters, or rescue centers (Canada offers many legitimate opportunities).
·Include experiences with large animals (horses, cattle) or wildlife/exotic species, demonstrating adaptability.
·Observe veterinarians in clinical, surgical, and preventive medicine contexts to understand daily professional routines.
·Reach out to local community colleges or university animal science departments via cold emails for research or lab internships in animal science, ecology, or physiology.
·Connect Biology, Public Health, and Environmental Sustainability through projects like:
·Zoonotic Diseases and One Health (linking animal and human health)
·Courses combining animal policy, bioethics, and environmental factors will add further intellectual dimension.
·Veterinary and scientific professions require clear, empathetic communication. Tong's outgoing personalitysupports excellence in:
·Educational Outreach (e.g., teaching younger students about science or wellness)
·Build understanding of animal care ethics through animal welfare advocacy, “Adopt, Don' t Shop" campaigns,and community education.
·At Havergal, Tong could found an "Animal & Wellness Club" that integrates animal care, sports, and mental wellness.
·Invite veterinarians, psychologists, and coaches as guest speakers.
·Lead Animal Awareness Week in collaboration with other schools to expand community impact.
Tong should choose electives that complement her interests in life and environmental sciences, such as:
·Animal Health, Behavior, Nutrition, Welfare, Public Health, and Environmental Science
·Courses in Bioethics, Animal Policy, or Environmental Factors
·These subjects strengthen her ability to approach animal science from both scientific and humanitarianperspectives.
·Work at local veterinary hospitals or animal clinics.
·Found a student animal welfare club promoting “Adopt, Don' t Shop" and partner with local shelters for adoption or awareness events.
·Conduct small-scale research or surveys on the positive effects of pets on youth mental health.
·Organize charity sports events (e.g., long-distance swims or rowing fundraisers) supporting animal protectionor mental health awareness.
·Launch a “Young Scientists in Sports" program - teaching younger students simple experiments on heart rate, respiration, or biomechanics to merge sports and science learning.
·Combine animal care, wellness, and sports through regular educational and outreach events.
·Partner with other girls' or international schools to organize Animal Awareness Week for wider community engagement.
·Send cold emails to nearby community colleges, universities, or animal research institutes to seek lab shadowing or short-term internships.

participates in making, eating, reviewing food, and learning about food.

- At Havergal, Tong could found an “Animal & Wellness Club" that integrates animal care, sports, and mental wellness.
- Invite veterinarians, psychologists, and coaches as guest speakers.
- Lead Animal Awareness Week in collaboration with other schools to expand community impact.
Observe veterinarians in clinical, surgical, and preventive medicine contexts to understand daily professional routines.

参加年级 职位角色 活动类型
时间规划 难度 重要性
2025.09.01-2025.12.31 ■低难度
Volunteer or intern at veterinary clinics, animal hospitals, shelters, or rescue centers (Canada offers many legitimate opportunities).

Encouraged to continue participating in the Food Club and run for the Sports Council again next year. The mentor noted that admissions officers understand leaddership often develops in junior/senior years.

参加年级 职位角色 活动类型
时间规划 难度 重要性
2026.01.01-2027.01.31 ■高难度
Suggested leveraging family resources to seek research or internship opportunities. Also, will teach her how to proactively reach out to professors via email.
这一部分记录了你已经获得的奖项、正在参加的比赛、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的下一步比赛或奖项荣誉获取计划。有含金量的学术类奖项能够在在校成绩和标化成绩体现学术能力基本面的基础上，进一步证明进阶学术实力，同时一些较为综合的比赛可以体现综合能力。学术主线相关的奖项往往是更重要的，另外与个人特色副线相关或其他体现个人特点的奖项也能增加奖项列表的立体性和个人特色。
这一部分记录了你已经参加的夏校、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的正在申请中或计划要申请的夏校。参加夏校可以帮助你在专业方向上提前进行大学水平的学习，其中含金量较高的夏校在大学申请时作用有时类似于学术类奖项，能够进一步证明进阶学术实力，并且可以通过夏校争取教授推荐信。另外上过某个大学的夏校也可以证明对该校的入读兴趣，对一些大学来说，这种情况下再选择ED申请该校会有加成。

![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/95d9d20f81d703ca.jpg) # 远期待办 ·Research Recommended LACs - Explore the websites of Fran klin & Marshall College, Colgate college,Whitman college,A mherst,HMC,Barnard ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/49bf21f631aa235c.jpg) ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/d47376c600ac9973.jpg) ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/65a7f2f63904850c.jpg) 这一部分展示了规划导师与你沟通交流以后为你制定的申请意向专业方向、申请国家、申请形象、学术主线、个人特色副线。申请形象指的是你的申请材料希望给招生官展现你是怎样一个人，在一些可量化可直接对比的成绩成就奖项等硬件之外，还能体现你怎样的个性、品质、故事、特点、兴趣和热情，往往这些软性的东西更能让招生官对你印象深刻。学术主线是申请意向专业方向的展开和细化，个人特色副线则是在学术主线之外你的第二主要特点，有可能是另一个有一定联系或一定反差的学术线，也有可能是非学术的例如户外冒险、艺术音乐、某种理念追求、某个方面的社会关怀等等。学术主线和个人特色副线共同塑造一个更为立体、更为多元、更有区分度的申请形象，使你从同专业方向的申请者中脱颖而出。 ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/302dadc2e5faf51a.jpg) **·申请方向选择理由** 喜欢动物 每周15小时运动，竞赛水平 # ·申请形象描述 Sportsmanship + Compassion for Life Exploring Animal Science·Nutrition·Welfare·Ecology emphasizes the connection between scientific curiosity, empathy for living beings, and physical discipline through sports. Her profile will evolve around the theme “Sportsmanship + Compassion for Life", highlighting both academic exploration in an imal and life sciences and impactful community engagement. 这一部分记录了你9-12年级完整的在校成绩情况。在校成绩是招生官对你学术能力判断的基础指标，好的在校成绩是申请顶尖大学的基本门槛。另外在校选课应体现与申请意向专业方向相一致或相关联的学术兴趣。 ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/734b6c295290eb05.jpg) 这一部分记录了你已经取得的各项标化考试成绩以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的的未来标化考试计划。标化考试成绩是在校成绩之外的又一重要学术实力评判标准，顾名思义，它的意义在于更为标准化，不同学校的在校成绩往往很难比较，标化考试成绩弥补了这一点，于是也是很被招生官看重的。另外一些所在高中并不知名的学生可以通过标化考试进一步证明自己的学术能力基本面。 这一部分记录了你已经完成的课外活动、正在进行的课外活动、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的下一步课外活动计划。课外活动是体现软实力的重要阵地，通过合理的规划，我们希望通过课外活动有重点、有层次、有细节、有亮点、生动全面地体现你的申请形象、学术主线、个人特色副线。将来在大学网申中你的活动细节无法在有限的活动列表描述字符中体现的部分我们也会考虑通过额外信息部分加以展开和展示。） ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/3eed1966507222e5.jpg) # ■课外活动规划思路 1.Academic Foundation (Science Coursework) ·High School Courses: ·Take advanced courses in Biology (cellular and molecular), Chemistry (including Organic Chemistry if available),and electives in Anatomy, Physiology, or Animal Behavior. ·Research or Laboratory Work: ·Join animal behavior, nutrition, or physiology research projects, or participate in community college or university lab internships to gain hands-on exposure to scientific inquiry. 1. Clinical and Practical Experience ·Veterinary and Animal Health Exposure: ·Volunteer or intern at veterinary clinics, animal hospitals, shelters, or rescue centers (Canada offers many legitimate opportunities). ·Broader Exposure: ·Include experiences with large animals (horses, cattle) or wildlife/exotic species, demonstrating adaptability. ·Shadowing Opportunities: ·Observe veterinarians in clinical, surgical, and preventive medicine contexts to understand daily professional routines. ·Extended Research Engagement: ·Reach out to local community colleges or university animal science departments via cold emails for research or lab internships in animal science, ecology, or physiology. 1. Interdisciplinary Integration ·Cross-Disciplinary Focus: ·Connect Biology, Public Health, and Environmental Sustainability through projects like: ·Animal-Environment Interactions ·Zoonotic Diseases and One Health (linking animal and human health) ·Environmental Impact on Animal Welfare ·Potential Academic Themes: ·Animal Health & Diseases ·Animal Behavior & Welfare ·Nutrition & Physiology ·Public Health & Ecology ·Environmental Science & Bioethics ·Courses combining animal policy, bioethics, and environmental factors will add further intellectual dimension. 1. Communication, Ethics,and Leadership ·Communication Development: ·Veterinary and scientific professions require clear, empathetic communication. Tong's outgoing personalitysupports excellence in: ·Debate and Public Speaking ·Community Workshops or Storytelling Projects ·Educational Outreach (e.g., teaching younger students about science or wellness) ·Ethical Awareness: ·Build understanding of animal care ethics through animal welfare advocacy, “Adopt, Don' t Shop" campaigns,and community education. ·Leadership Projects: ·At Havergal, Tong could found an "Animal & Wellness Club" that integrates animal care, sports, and mental wellness. ·Invite veterinarians, psychologists, and coaches as guest speakers. ·Lead Animal Awareness Week in collaboration with other schools to expand community impact. # 1. Electives and Interdisciplinary Courses Tong should choose electives that complement her interests in life and environmental sciences, such as: ·Animal Ecology & Conservation ·Integrative Physiology & Nutrition ·Animal Health, Behavior, Nutrition, Welfare, Public Health, and Environmental Science ·Courses in Bioethics, Animal Policy, or Environmental Factors ·These subjects strengthen her ability to approach animal science from both scientific and humanitarianperspectives. 1. Impact-Oriented Activity Design (1) Animal Care & Welfare ·Volunteering: ·Work at local veterinary hospitals or animal clinics. ·Rescue & Advocacy Projects: ·Found a student animal welfare club promoting “Adopt, Don' t Shop" and partner with local shelters for adoption or awareness events. ·Pet+ Psychology Research: ·Conduct small-scale research or surveys on the positive effects of pets on youth mental health. (2) Sports and Social Responsibility ·Rowing for Cause / Swim for Change: ·Organize charity sports events (e.g., long-distance swims or rowing fundraisers) supporting animal protectionor mental health awareness. ·Sports + STEM Initiative: ·Launch a “Young Scientists in Sports" program - teaching younger students simple experiments on heart rate, respiration, or biomechanics to merge sports and science learning. ## (3) Leadership & Collaboration ·Founding the "Animal & Wellness Club" at Havergal: ·Combine animal care, wellness, and sports through regular educational and outreach events. ·Cross-School Collaboration: ·Partner with other girls' or international schools to organize Animal Awareness Week for wider community engagement. ·Outreach to Colleges: ·Send cold emails to nearby community colleges, universities, or animal research institutes to seek lab shadowing or short-term internships. ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/2f3b56b2ff3b8f27.jpg) ### 已完成活动 ### Food Club Member

Also, will teach her how to proactively reach out to professors via email. ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/f53872ef0f7aafb0.jpg) ![](https://web-api.textin.com/ocr_image/external/cfe70547432c9238.jpg) 这一部分记录了你已经获得的奖项、正在参加的比赛、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的下一步比赛或奖项荣誉获取计划。有含金量的学术类奖项能够在在校成绩和标化成绩体现学术能力基本面的基础上，进一步证明进阶学术实力，同时一些较为综合的比赛可以体现综合能力。学术主线相关的奖项往往是更重要的，另外与个人特色副线相关或其他体现个人特点的奖项也能增加奖项列表的立体性和个人特色。 这一部分记录了你已经参加的夏校、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的正在申请中或计划要申请的夏校。参加夏校可以帮助你在专业方向上提前进行大学水平的学习，其中含金量较高的夏校在大学申请时作用有时类似于学术类奖项，能够进一步证明进阶学术实力，并且可以通过夏校争取教授推荐信。另外上过某个大学的夏校也可以证明对该校的入读兴趣，对一些大学来说，这种情况下再选择ED申请该校会有加成。

体现软实力的重要阵地，通过合理的规划，我们希望通过课外活动有重点、有层次、有细节、有亮点、生动全面地体现你的申请形象、学术主
线、个人特色副线。将来在大学网申中你的活动细节无法在有限的活动列表描述字符中体现的部分我们也会考虑通过额外信息部分加以展开
·Take advanced courses in Biology (cellular and molecular), Chemistry (including Organic Chemistry if available),and
electives in Anatomy, Physiology, or Animal Behavior.
·Join animal behavior, nutrition, or physiology research projects, or participate in community college or university lab
internships to gain hands-on exposure to scientific inquiry.
·Volunteer or intern at veterinary clinics, animal hospitals, shelters, or rescue centers (Canada offers many legitimate
·Include experiences with large animals (horses, cattle) or wildlife/exotic species, demonstrating adaptability.
·Observe veterinarians in clinical, surgical, and preventive medicine contexts to understand daily professional routines.

internships in animal science, ecology, or physiology.

structured.text: 这一部分记录了你已经完成的课外活动、正在进行的课外活动、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的下一步课外活动计划。课外活动是体现软实力的重要阵地，通过合理的规划，我们希望通过课外活动有重点、有层次、有细节、有亮点、生动全面地体现你的申请形象、学术主线、个人特色副线。将来在大学网申中你的活动细节无法在有限的活动列表描述字符中体现的部分我们也会考虑通过额外信息部分加以展开和展示。）
·Take advanced courses in Biology (cellular and molecular), Chemistry (including Organic Chemistry if available),and electives in Anatomy, Physiology, or Animal Behavior.
·Join animal behavior, nutrition, or physiology research projects, or participate in community college or university lab internships to gain hands-on exposure to scientific inquiry.
·Volunteer or intern at veterinary clinics, animal hospitals, shelters, or rescue centers (Canada offers many legitimate opportunities).
·Include experiences with large animals (horses, cattle) or wildlife/exotic species, demonstrating adaptability.
·Observe veterinarians in clinical, surgical, and preventive medicine contexts to understand daily professional routines.
·Reach out to local community colleges or university animal science departments via cold emails for research or lab internships in animal science, ecology, or physiology.
·Connect Biology, Public Health, and Environmental Sustainability through projects like:
·Zoonotic Diseases and One Health (linking animal and human health)
·Courses combining animal policy, bioethics, and environmental factors will add further intellectual dimension.
·Veterinary and scientific professions require clear, empathetic communication. Tong's outgoing personalitysupports excellence in:
·Educational Outreach (e.g., teaching younger students about science or wellness)
·Build understanding of animal care ethics through animal welfare advocacy, “Adopt, Don' t Shop" campaigns,and community education.
·At Havergal, Tong could found an "Animal & Wellness Club" that integrates animal care, sports, and mental wellness.
·Invite veterinarians, psychologists, and coaches as guest speakers.
·Lead Animal Awareness Week in collaboration with other schools to expand community impact.
Tong should choose electives that complement her interests in life and environmental sciences, such as:
·Animal Health, Behavior, Nutrition, Welfare, Public Health, and Environmental Science
·Courses in Bioethics, Animal Policy, or Environmental Factors
·These subjects strengthen her ability to approach animal science from both scientific and humanitarianperspectives.
·Work at local veterinary hospitals or animal clinics.
·Found a student animal welfare club promoting “Adopt, Don' t Shop" and partner with local shelters for adoption or awareness events.
·Conduct small-scale research or surveys on the positive effects of pets on youth mental health.
·Organize charity sports events (e.g., long-distance swims or rowing fundraisers) supporting animal protectionor mental health awareness.
·Launch a “Young Scientists in Sports" program - teaching younger students simple experiments on heart rate, respiration, or biomechanics to merge sports and science learning.
·Combine animal care, wellness, and sports through regular educational and outreach events.

·Send cold emails to nearby community colleges, universities, or animal research institutes to seek lab shadowing or short-term internships.

content.text: 这一部分记录了你已经获得的奖项、正在参加的比赛、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的下一步比赛或奖项荣誉获取计划。有含金量
的学术类奖项能够在在校成绩和标化成绩体现学术能力基本面的基础上，进一步证明进阶学术实力，同时一些较为综合的比赛可以体现综合能
力。学术主线相关的奖项往往是更重要的，另外与个人特色副线相关或其他体现个人特点的奖项也能增加奖项列表的立体性和个人特色。

structured.text: 这一部分记录了你已经获得的奖项、正在参加的比赛、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的下一步比赛或奖项荣誉获取计划。有含金量的学术类奖项能够在在校成绩和标化成绩体现学术能力基本面的基础上，进一步证明进阶学术实力，同时一些较为综合的比赛可以体现综合能力。学术主线相关的奖项往往是更重要的，另外与个人特色副线相关或其他体现个人特点的奖项也能增加奖项列表的立体性和个人特色。

content.text: 这一部分记录了你已经参加的夏校、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的正在申请中或计划要申请的夏校。参加夏校可以帮助你在专业
方向上提前进行大学水平的学习，其中含金量较高的夏校在大学申请时作用有时类似于学术类奖项，能够进一步证明进阶学术实力，并且可以
通过夏校争取教授推荐信。另外上过某个大学的夏校也可以证明对该校的入读兴趣，对一些大学来说，这种情况下再选择ED申请该校会有加

structured.text: 这一部分记录了你已经参加的夏校、以及规划导师与你沟通交流以后一起制定的正在申请中或计划要申请的夏校。参加夏校可以帮助你在专业方向上提前进行大学水平的学习，其中含金量较高的夏校在大学申请时作用有时类似于学术类奖项，能够进一步证明进阶学术实力，并且可以通过夏校争取教授推荐信。另外上过某个大学的夏校也可以证明对该校的入读兴趣，对一些大学来说，这种情况下再选择ED申请该校会有加成。
